questions.question: The two brothers quarreled with ……………………..
questions.description: Each other refers to two people one another refers to more than two people.

questions.question: We must love ………………………….
questions.description: Each other refers to two people one another refers to more than two people. Each other is also possible here in a less careful style.

questions.question: Let ………………………….. buy something to eat.
questions.description: Let is a verb. A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I am not as tall as …………………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are common after as and than.

questions.question: Each of the boys ………………………………. given a present.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: People starve when …………………………… have no money.
questions.description: Use they to refer to the plural noun people.

questions.question: I like …………………………… kind of movies.
questions.description: Use this with kind and these with kinds.

questions.question: I do not like these ………………………….. of people.
questions.description: Use sorts with these and those.

questions.question: ……………………….. a cloudy day, we did not go out.
My handwriting is better than .............................
questions.description: Your handwriting cannot be better than your friend it can only be better than the handwriting (=that) of your friend.
